website_summaries.verdict: A good price for 60 quality treat-like chews, especially since they're loaded with premium ingredients like glucosamine HCl and manganese to help older and heavier cats.
pros: Includes glucosamine and MSM for joint support
Small and soft bites for cats
cons: This advanced recipe is mostly intended for senior cats already dealing with joint issues

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these- I hope they help.
customer_reviews.text: My ancient cat has arthritis is her front joints, I buy these regularly to help ease her joint pain. I don't know they work 100% - as cat doesn't speak English very well, but I can say every night she nudges the bag to remind me to give her the nightly dose. If they make old lady cat happy - they make me happy. Also, she loves these but won't touch her food if I sprinkle glucosamine on her food. Oh, and other cat who does not have arthritis doesn't have any interest, so  ̄\_(ツ)_/ ̄. Please see the Before & After photos Real Client - You results may vary
customer_reviews.author: Nicky Lynne

customer_reviews.title: KITTY APPROVED!
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loves these!! She gets one plus regular kitty treats every night. She gets impatient if she is waiting for her treats past 8pm and lets me know. They are soft, not too big, no foul odor, smells like a regular kitty treat-maybe fish flavor? These were recommended by my vet for my aging kitty's arthritis. I think it has helped, she doesn't seem to be limping as much. I did this instead of using harsher treatments. She has been taking them for the past few months now. I will continue to buy this product and highly recommend. Kitty approved!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly G

customer_reviews.title: Smell bad, don't know if they work... cat is now indignant
customer_reviews.text: My cat won't go near these. If I open the bag he kind of sniffs the air and then leaves the room. He'll eat bugs... so that's saying something. UPDATE: My cat finally ate two of these treats when I hid them in his food and he proceeded immediately to lose them and the food on the floor. I spent a bit of time cleaning up and realized that he's probably smarter than I am. Turns out he didn't want to eat them for a reason. Moral: Don't force your pets to eat things they don't like the smell of!
customer_reviews.author: JuanDough

customer_reviews.title: Vomit and lots of it.
customer_reviews.text: I am swearing off vetriscience products. My cat will eats these treats, but ever since they changed their formula and packaging, these and the lysine treats BOTH make him vomit an extraordinary amount and multiple times 100% of the time. I used to give him one of these treats everyday as a supplement with no issues, but now, they are completely unusable. I suspect it’s something in the inactive ingredients in both products that is causing my cat severe intensional distress. I won’t be using vetriscience products anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Abston

customer_reviews.title: Recipe changed?!?!
customer_reviews.text: I had bought the same brand of these from my vet and had no problems, but then when I bought them off of Amazon it seems like the recipe had changed because my cat all of a sudden lost a bunch of hair and seems to be allergic to them... This really sucks because my cat is extremely picky and will not eat anything and he actually did eat these OK, Originally they had also seem to be helping him with his arthritis but I had to stop giving them to him after he exhibited the allergy
customer_reviews.author: hedlu055

customer_reviews.title: My cat won't eat them and he eats practically anything ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat won't eat them and he eats practically anything. I tried calling the phone number listed on the pkg and it just rings -- no answer and no chance to leave a message. I'll contact Amazon for a refund. My cat did eat the first few but the chews then became soft and sticky after the pkg was opened which made them nasty to handle and Moe (our cat) quit eating them. When they started getting soft and gooey they took on more smell. maybe that's what turned Moe off.
customer_reviews.author: jaycee

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This product is great even for small dogs, as I have a Chihuahua that weighs 5lbs and my Vet recommended this item to keep her joints strong. It works as she had not had any issues in the past 2 years on this product. Prior to this she had an issue her left rear knee (bilateral patella luxation) that required surgery at the age of 12 months, which cost $2600 to repair. This product has keep me from having the same issue on her remaining knees.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie B.

customer_reviews.title: Cat Vomited MULTIPLE Times
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try these with my foster cat. He ate the two recommended treats which I war thrilled about because he can be picky about treats. My excitement did not last long. He vomited FIVE times not long after ingesting the treats and this was several hours after eating anything else. This cat is not a barfer (cat owners will understand) so this was totally out of character for him. I felt awful watching him dry heave a couple of times. I love other VetriScience products but I will never be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Boegner

customer_reviews.title: I love when supplements ACTUALLY work!
customer_reviews.text: I have a picky kitty and she took to these right away. No, she doesn't run up to them like she does treats (fatty), but I throw 1 in her dry food every morning & she eats it, no problem! I'm always a little cynical when it comes to supplements. I rarely feel like they work "on their own". Yet, this DID work on it's own! Kitty had been limping for a month but nothing drastic. I didn't think it was arthritis because she was only 7. I tried these chews, as a last effort before taking her to the vet. They worked in less than a week of taking. Blown away!
customer_reviews.author: Mary D.

customer_reviews.title: Picky cat doesn't like chicken liver flavor
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few of their products, Joint Relief, Composure and Probiotics. The first two of them are chicken liver flavor and my cat won't eat them. She loves the probiotic chews but I have to break them up for her. They're soft to break up easily and I'll keep using them. I got them because my newly adopted cat is at least 10 years old and her poo will kill you! It smells terrible!! Two months in with one daily her poo still smells bad but not deadly.
customer_reviews.author: tick

customer_reviews.title: Seems to make a difference in joint pain and mobility
customer_reviews.text: I notice a difference in my cat's movements. I had been giving her a different treat with glucosamine, but I couldn't find it anywhere so we gave these a try. It took several days before she would eat it, she didn't like them at first, but now she eats them everyday and has been walking better since.
customer_reviews.author: Joell

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't Believe How Fast I Saw A Change!
customer_reviews.text: I started giving my 11 year old cat one of these chews a day (not the recommended two a day) about a week ago. Yesterday, my cat jumped off the couch and started chasing a string around the room...my cat hasn't played with string in YEARS. He's normally just an old grumpy cat who sleeps in your lap. I couldn't believe how fast I saw a change in him even using a lower dosage than recommended. The only side effect I'm not enjoying is the wicked chicken liver breath, bleh! But still totally worth it. I will continue to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon-aholic

customer_reviews.title: Vet recommended
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended these for my cat with arthritis pain ahs I can't tiny Amazon to buy second batch. Cat likes these as treats but I'm not sure they are helping much; we are on week six of daily dose. Product that arrived was very fresh (not hard/dry). Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: My cat doesn't particularly like the flavor but I won't give her her treats until she eats the supplement. Tough love....so, she eats them. Plus, I don't' have to pay for the more expensive salmon flavor, which she loves. Best of all, this product works... my cat stopped limpy after 5 weeks. Very happy with the product!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: Great snack..in test phase with Max
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product..Max is 10yrs old and has 1 bite a day...loves them.On back legs seems to help.Longer time will confirm this,too early to be guaranteed it's working well .Meantime great snack and good potential to help him for those days where stiffness flares up.Excellent due to taste and potential to help..will try 90days and re-review
customer_reviews.author: T. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Cat turned her nose up
customer_reviews.text: My cat didn’t like these at all. I gave them to some friends and their cats don’t like them either. It’s too bad because they were expensive and I really want to help my cat’s joints feel better. I’m really glad I didn’t buy them from from the vet that recommended glucosamine, they were twice as much $ there. Can anyone recommend a brand their cat enjoys?
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Great taste, great benefits.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these treats! He is a large cat (~15 lbs when at ideal body condition), so I have always been concerned about his joint health as he ages. The ingredients in these treats (glucosamine and MSM) are the same I use for my own joint support These ingredients have also been found to help with bladder and urinary issues in cats!
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Not for my kitty
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 11 year old cat in the hopes that it would help with some joint issues. She threw up after the first time I gave it to her. I thought maybe it was a fluke and tried again the next day. Same thing happened, threw up all over the place. So no more chews for her. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: B. D.

customer_reviews.title: Problem with my cat and these chews
customer_reviews.text: I really dislike giving low ratings when the problem with this product may just be my cat. She normally does not have a sensitive stomach so we were surprised when she began throwing up, and it was several times. She's 13 years old and an inside cat, so we were able to monitor her. She loved these treats but we limited them to one morning and evening. She continued to throw up and began diahrrea. So we stopped these and she has been ok ever since. We had been using a different joint supplement (also from Amazon) so went back to that brand. She has been fine ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Vintage Princess

customer_reviews.title: Turns out they're great after all!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I bought them, I thought they were the cause of a digestive upset she had. Turned out it wasn't the treats but something else. She loves the taste of these (she hated the Cosequin in her food). Now I can't get them delivered to Alaska and I don't know why, so I have to buy them (at a far greater price) at the local pet store. I tried other brands but they don't work. She loves these, and my kittens try to steal them from her, so I have to shoo them away while she eats them, lol.
customer_reviews.author: kkirk

customer_reviews.title: For arthritis in cats
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this and so do I. Before you could hear her walking, squeaking in the joints. Now after 3-4 days its gone. This is our second order so its good stuff. Will tell you they have trouble smelling the meat flavor unless you break it into.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Very effective!
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES these treats and they have helped his arthritis so much! I can really tell when he skips a dose and so can he, the poor thing. He is 14-15 years old and just recently bothered by the arthritis in his hips. He moves much more comfortably when he gets his treat morning and evening. I’m putting this on auto ship so he never runs out!
customer_reviews.author: Julie N

customer_reviews.title: Taste that cats love and great for overall health
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough good things about this product! My senior kitty Who dislikes almost all cat food and treats loves these and begs for more! Not only that, I have noticed a marked improvement in his overall health. His appetite is amazing and he no longer craves the junk foods of cat foods and is eating my top shelf cat food along with my other two! He’s happier and more playful and less grouchy🐱.
customer_reviews.author: Diane L. Repasky

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT !!!
customer_reviews.text: Just like me, my 12+ year old fat cat has noticeable joint and other pains, especially suring the winter and wet or cold weather. This stuff really works miracles. He loves the taste and it there was a noticable difference almost from day one. Already ordered the next month's supply. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Maker Mac

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love these nutritious treats.
customer_reviews.text: These treats are a hit with our cats. Likes: - Nutritious. Contains protein, and a good amount of vitamins and minerals. - Tasty: our cats love these things. - Good value. 60 treats for the price. - Great packaging. Love the new branding, as well as the resealable pouch. Other thoughts: - The science on glucosamine / msm / dmg for joint health seems a bit mixed, but (a) our cats love these and (b) the ingredients are safe, as far as I can tell. Overall we love these treats for our older cats with clicky, worn out joints. The glucosamine hasn't eliminated joint noise, but our cats love these, and they are safe and nutritious. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fabbri

customer_reviews.title: Trying stage 3 now
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how well this worked on our cat; he doesn't seem to have his discomfort eliviated (after use of the whole bag). Just bought the Orange Strenght 3, hope that will improve the situation. Our cat is a 13 year old Orange Tabby, 8-9 lb. very active (got 5 rats in May), but he seems to be sensitive to touch on his hind area, and when he walks it shows sign of aging. (Guess when his hunting instinct kicks in, the adrenalin takes over).
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Paulsen

customer_reviews.title: Cats love em, good ingredients!
customer_reviews.text: These, like other similar supplements, are a bit dry, so what I always do is fill the bag with water, and pour it out, but stopping juuuuusssst before it all leaks out. Seal, and lay on it's side and 24 hours later, youve got the perfect moist consistency that the cats LOVE.
customer_reviews.author: BaldCats

customer_reviews.title: I take some bazillion gluocucamin a day so I get it but to see him it affected so quickly is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: So, the Bengal has been fussy and talking about it (the Bengal is Very Vocal about all things) and we'd noticed that he'd been climbing instead of jumping so as I have a knee arthritis I could relate. We ordered this and almost instantly he responded. I take some bazillion gluocucamin a day so I get it but to see him it affected so quickly is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: terrorcotta

customer_reviews.title: Works for our Kit Kit :)
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this as well as ci squib for our 11 year old cat who is having joint issues. We give her two treats every morning and her two cosequin pills each night with her food. Between the two supplements we have seen alotnof improvement in her mobility. Delivery is always great with Amazon Prime and we have recently set this product up on a subscription so we have a new bag ready each month to continue her supplements and regiment.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: This was a bad package of cat chews.
customer_reviews.text: This package of cat chews was spoiled - it smelled terrible and there was no way my cat, who has arthritis and who normally loves these chews, would eat it. The first package I ordered from Amazon was fine but I will purchase these from my cat’s veterinarian in the future so I will have a better chance of getting a fresh package and be able to exchange it the same day if it turns out to be bad.
customer_reviews.author: bluejay

customer_reviews.title: Not really chewy, not sure if they worked, and made the cat vomit.
customer_reviews.text: The "chews" we got were hard as a rock, not chewy at all. I can't be sure if they actually helped our cat at all. The Vet says she has arthritis in her back and recommended these treats, but I didn't really see any change in the cat's behavior. The worst part is the vomiting! We went through the bag from the vet with no problem. Then we ordered the same ones from Amazon and every 2nd or 3rd afternoon the cat would vomit up all of her food. We cut out the treats for a week and the vomiting stopped. Then we gave her one treat and later that day she puked again. It's got to be the treats!
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Ball

customer_reviews.title: Great pain reliever in a chew
customer_reviews.text: I can’t really comment on pain relief and taste since it’s my dog that uses this product at the request of the vet. However my dog does seem happier so it must be making her feel better
customer_reviews.author: Judy Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great medicine!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is 13 years old and it is most showing in her hips. She has started to have problems jumping on the couch and cried any time I touched her hips. She had been on this for a month now and has made great progress. She has started playing more with the other cat and her jumping has greatly improved. And she no longer cries or growls when I touch her hips.
customer_reviews.author: bridgegirljen02

customer_reviews.title: Amazing help for my 17 year old arthritic kitty!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! My cat is 18 years old and has been diagnosed with arthritis. It was obvious that she was getting uncomfortable moving around; not jumping up on furniture and very hesitant to jump down. I followed the directions on this product and now have her on one piece a day (which she devours.) The difference over the last couple of months is amazing! She's running around, jumping up on the couches and climbing her 54" cat condo too so she can hang out and watch the wildlife in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: My cat appears comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old male cat has been taking it for years - he can’t jump as high as he used to but he can run up and down the stairs, plays with leaves and appears to be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret W.

customer_reviews.title: Stay far far far away!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. It's always inconsistent quality. Sometimes its rock hard and now my cat won't even eat it. It should be super soft. There is no quality control here.
customer_reviews.author: Pash

customer_reviews.title: My cat will not eat these as a treat so ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat will not eat these as a treat so I have to crumble them in his food. I started giving him NuCat Senior vitamins when he was ten. Then Vetri Science separated the vitamins and joint care. So I purchased these. Sir Ellsworth Bigglesworth is now 15 and has the agility of a much younger cat. He runs and jumps with ease. I also gave them to my older cats that have passed and they were active until the end. I'm a true believer in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy L.

customer_reviews.title: Cat threw up several times
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted these to work for my 13 yr old Ragdoll that had leg hip problems She liked the taste but threw up several times I gave it to her right before her food this is concerning coming from a cat that never throws up . I will have to go back to sprinkling the Cosequen on her food.
customer_reviews.author: Kittycatz

customer_reviews.title: My cat would not eat these
customer_reviews.text: I have an elderly cat who has arthritis and thought these chews would help him, but I guess he's too fussy as he would not eat them. I gave them to a neighbor who is giving them to her cat who is not so fussy!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helped elmininate joint issues in large male cat.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cats have been on it for years after my large male cat developed some joint issues, and the Vet recommended it. Since going in Glycoflex and Dasuquin, no more joint issues.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Joint Support!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Two years ago our sweet cat Lily had surgery for a torn ligament in her knee. A year later we moved temporarily to a two story house and were very concerned about her going up and down the stairs which are quite steep. Our homeopathic Vet recommended GlycoFlex 2 for joint support and she flies up and down the stairs with ease. We are very grateful that this product has helped keep her knee and joints healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Baazumi

customer_reviews.title: My small cat eats these!
customer_reviews.text: I have a small cat 20 years old and healthy. These she will eat. Another brand comes in a capsule which I had to open and sprinkle on her food and the she would not eat it. Seems to help her mobility. She still climbs and jumps.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S.

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for awhile
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my senior cat because I noticed her walking stiffly and not being as mobile as she had been. For the first week it went great but after that I couldn't get my cat to eat them for anything. Not sure why, but I'm on the hunt for a different joint treat. I didn't get to use these long enough to see if they made any difference in her mobility.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for cats but these were hard as rocks
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3 legged 14 yr old cat with arthritis and trouble getting around on her remaining legs. My vet recommended this product as it's hard to pill a cat everyday. My cat loves this stuff. When I normally buy this from my vet the pieces are chewy and soft. For some reason these are hard as rocks. Not sure why.
customer_reviews.author: Dipsy Doodle

customer_reviews.title: My older cat LOVES these!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Large Maine Coone who can become very picky with his treats. He has trouble with his hips and joints when I don't give him the joint supplements, but there are not many that he likes. I am also picky about the ingredients in many of these treats, and like them to be as natural as possible without fillers like by-products. The few that my cat does like, he often tires of mid-way through the bag. He hasn't tired of these yet, and I've already gone through multiple bags! He looks forward to his treats every day!
customer_reviews.author: MsDove

customer_reviews.title: Works Extremely Well
customer_reviews.text: This Joint Supplement is amazing! I was given this by our vet for our 18 year old girl because she has problems with her back legs; jumping, using the litter box, etc, and she was simply laying around all day (which we thought was just because of her age). After being on this for 1 month, she is running around the house chasing our 2 year old around all day, jumping up places on her first try, and acting herself again. She looks forward to it everyday (even our 2 year old wants to eat it!). Definitely give this to your older kitties; I'm sure they will love it.
customer_reviews.author: XNightmareX77

customer_reviews.title: Give it a try.
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend a person try this for an older cat. Orca is 13 now and we were worried about the various jumps she has to make to her favorite places. We just break one of these up every morning and she eats it so that part is good. I feel she has been a bit more active than she used to be; not a lot but she races from end-to-end of the house at night. She used to do that but was doing it less. Now we get woken up with her skirmishes. I also think it is a preventative product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great for small dog stiff joints
customer_reviews.text: These were prescribed by my vet for my 11 lb maltese dog. (I say that specifically because this package says for cats on it. They don't make these chews for dogs in a size appropriate for my dog's weight.) He had shown some stiffness of movement so they suggested I start giving them to him. I saw immediate results in just the first couple of days in his freedom of movement. I did a whole package at two chews per day and then went to one chew per day when I started the second package. The chews are very small and my dog loves them. It is his morning treat.
customer_reviews.author: Gwench

customer_reviews.title: Really helped my cats joints...made them stop cracking with every step!
customer_reviews.text: I don't often write reviews but this worked so well for my cat's joints that I felt I had to. Before he started taking this supplement his joints would crack loudly with almost every step he took. Now I barely hear them crack and certainly not with every step he took. We tried the Gylco Felx 3 (which are supposed to be more powerful) and they did not help at all. We are back on 2 and his joints are doing much better again. Try it!

customer_reviews.title: Works Fast
customer_reviews.text: I saw the changes in my 13 year old Tuxedo. He's not a little cat, being able to stretch out 34" from tip of paw to tip of foot. You could see after five days, his shoulders weren't hurting him to the point he was limping.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Schreiner

customer_reviews.title: I bought a package of these about a year ago ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a package of these about a year ago for my elderly cat. The product has made a huge difference in his mobility. He'll be 21 next spring and can still jump on the couch, go up and down stairs, etc.. I think that they also help his bladder because of the soothing ingredients. I have to break the treats up in small pieces for him. They are moist and crumbly so it isn't a problem. He likes the taste, which is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen S.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Supplements In 2 Chews!
customer_reviews.text: The strength of 2 chews in conjunction with the Cosequin seem to be helping my 15 year old cat out a lot. Granted, he's no spring chicken he'll never jump off the couch or jump on it any longer, but he climbs up his kitty stairs with ease. Really doesn't help with arthritis. Out of my 3 cats, only 1 truly likes this. 1 is a treat snob and she truly turns her nose up, the other will eat it when he's in the mood. I agree with some others who says to buy the dog chews as you get more for your money. Probably will go that route next time.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley B

customer_reviews.title: Healthy cat treats
customer_reviews.text: My cat is 15 and she is starting to have some joint problems. I used to give her the PetCo brand of joint treats, but for some reason those have been unavailable for over a year. These treats have the glucosamine that she needs along with other vitamins and natural flavors - plus, they're a little bit softer than our old brand, so she has an easier time eating them. She goes crazy for these treats, and they're definitely the brand I'm going to stick with.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using glyco-flex ii for cats since October 2011, and my 13 year old who was having problems jumping on the bed is now an acrobatics cat. He has so much energy that he acts like a kitten. I asked my vet what was the best product for joint problems and she recommended it. My cat loves the taste and every evening when I'm on my bed, he gets on my chest ready to have his glyco treat. If you don't know what to get for your furry animal this is your answer. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: oath101

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed with this
customer_reviews.text: This product worked wonders for my 2 yr. old Scottish Fold. HERE IS THE PROBLEM: Amazon changed this to an add on item, so being a Prime member is of no use. We order from Amazon constantly, tons of stuff. NOT ONE OF ITEM QUALIFIES FOR ADD ON. This has happened to me many times, and mostly with pet or people supplements. I am very disappointed with this.
customer_reviews.author: Becca Helen

customer_reviews.title: ... glucosamine for my cat when his knee was so bad he couldn't walk very far before he had to ...
customer_reviews.text: My vet suggested we try glucosamine for my cat when his knee was so bad he couldn't walk very far before he had to stop and lay down where he was. The bottle they wanted to sell me would last 30 days and it would cost me $50+. I tried this product and in just a few days my cat was running and jumping around like a kitten. He loves the flavor - he thinks he's getting a treat. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen M.

customer_reviews.title: Feel bad I didn't notice sooner and he's been having these ...
customer_reviews.text: Cat likes the treat even though they are very hard and smell awful. However. He vomits when he eats them. I believe they work but not worth the upset stomach. Feel bad I didn't notice sooner and he's been having these everyday. Will try another brand and not purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: I love these but it’s hot or miss to get a fresh package. Fresh ones are moist and squishy. Older packages are hard and not easy to break apart. This particular one I just opened as I received it and they are stale, hard, and obviously not fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Westley Mae

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Love
customer_reviews.text: My 16 (85 in human years) year old kitty is moving better already. He was beginning to have a hard time jumping up onto my bed. Now he jumps up like he is still a young guy. He will be taking these from now on. Because they are treats, no having to fight to get him to eat them.
customer_reviews.author: shoe1

customer_reviews.title: Great for older cat
customer_reviews.text: Our 16-year-old Maine Coon cat was having problems with walking, running, and jumping. This was further aggravated because she has a broken knee from when she was a kitten (before we got her). About 2 months after putting her on Glyco-Flex, her walking, running, and jumping returned to her previous state. Not perfect because of the broken knee, but as good as when she was at 5 to 10 years old. We give her 2/3 of a chew twice a day, so a 60-count bag lasts 45 days. Note this is for Glyco-Flex II Feline, don't know if any of the other Glyco-Flex would give similar results.
customer_reviews.author: LynneG

customer_reviews.title: Close, but not quite.
customer_reviews.text: Sigh. I was so full of hope. My eldest cat, the one who needs this, ate them with gusto for the first few days. And then--I don't know if it's poor bag design or what, but the treats started to dry out at an alarming rate (I CLOSED THE BAG, I SWEAR) and he wouldn't touch them anymore. He's a picky cat, so I don't know if it was the dryness or just that the newness of the treats wore off, but it'll be a while before I try this brand again. In the meantime, my mother's horrible cat is happily eating these. But he's horrible, and he eats rats, so take that as you will.
customer_reviews.author: D.S.B.

customer_reviews.title: I really wished my cats liked this, but they don't
customer_reviews.text: I really wished my cats liked this, but they don't. For one...the bites are way to big. They need to be about half size...and crunchy not chewy would be better.
customer_reviews.author: lattle

customer_reviews.title: Vet recomended and my cat likes them too
customer_reviews.text: The vet I take my cats to recomended that I give my older male cat one Glyco-Flex chew a day to help with his joints and limberness. They gave me some samples and my cat loved the taste of them right from the start (a BIG consideration where a cat is concerned). The only problem I found was the price the vet wanted to charge me for the suppliment-it wsa $32.00 a bag!! Needless to say, after a quick search on Amazon I found several vendors who offered them for as low as $9.00 a bag. Where do you think I spent, and continue to spend my shopping dollars?
customer_reviews.author: R. Guarino

customer_reviews.title: Was really hopeful for this product. Wanted to give ...
customer_reviews.text: Was really hopeful for this product. Wanted to give it to my cat after she had her crucitate ligament repaired but she vomited within a half hour every time we gave her these. We followed the feeding directions but she must have a real sensitive stomach!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Siamese doortop walker
customer_reviews.text: The picky siamese likes them. They are softish. She is 14 and starting to limp. I just started her on these and so far the limp is slowly improving. These things usually take a few months before you see significant results, but my main concern was whether she would take it.
customer_reviews.author: Miamomma

customer_reviews.title: Great treats!
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this brand of treats to me when she noticed stiffness and arthritis in my cat's back legs. She said that most cats over the age of eight have arthritis and could benefit from glucosamine, so I ordered a pack and have not stopped ever since. She's been like a whole new cat, playing more than ever and being like her kitten self again. Would highly recommend for older cats.
customer_reviews.author: K.E.

customer_reviews.title: Cats like them
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought these for my aging cats at the suggestion of my vet. My cats love them and benefit from the natural pain relief.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wharton

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for 13 y/o cat who has been toothless for ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 13 y/o cat who has been toothless for 10+ years. Chews are NOT SOFT. Cat has easier time gumming down her dry cereal food and "Temptation" cat treats than these. Will keep looking; in the meantime I split "chew" in half and then use meat mallet to smash it down. Please change description of product to fit the actual texture.
customer_reviews.author: A-

customer_reviews.title: Vet recommended but it's much cheaper here
customer_reviews.text: Vet recommended but it's much cheaper here. Feral kitten with bad knees, she's been eating these for 2 years, she's 3yrs. old. Without these she's limping and can't run like her sister. With this supplement, half at breakfast & half at supper, she has almost no limp.
customer_reviews.author: Cornelia A. Lind

customer_reviews.title: TWINNY LOVES HIS "TREATS"
customer_reviews.text: My cat has been on these "treats" since last year. He's 15 years old and for a few years he started with swelling in his legs, limping, and having difficulty walking and he was in so much pain. After a trip to the Vet last year he prescribed these and within a week he was much better and all this winter we had NO SWELLING, and although he is careful in his step, he has not shown any of the prior years difficulties. He can jump up on a chair, or even the sofa. I am on my 2nd set of 240 chews...Twinny loves them, and my other cats are always trying to steal them away from him.
customer_reviews.author: R. Crincoli

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves these
customer_reviews.text: He loves them and is feeling so much better...he is a new kitty at 12 yeard of age!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: pam

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Dry and unappetizing. No way to know if they help my nearly 19yo DSH because he wouldn't touch them. His vet, however, says her sr kitty likes them and they help with mobility. Worth a try, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: kittenspawn

customer_reviews.title: Palatable for my Pussycat
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old Emmy, has arhtiritis and I could not use the Capsules on her food as I could not be confident she would eat it all, as she is a picker at her food, rather than eating it all at once. She LOVES these treats, so I am about to order more. Although there seems to be a package change since I bought mine here last week. I am hoping that the content remains unchanged. Time will tell if she begins to walk better, but at least I can get the stuff into her in this chew form.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: This is a product for older cats and the problem ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a product for older cats and the problem is older cats have old teeth. These are so hard my senior cat cant chew them. I break them up in her food an just hope they work for her this way.
customer_reviews.author: Yogi

customer_reviews.title: It works well in senior dogs with stiff joints.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for lubricating the joints of my senior small breed dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Cat takes the chews well
customer_reviews.text: Our cat seems to like the chews. She readily takes as a daily treat.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Apparantly it is good for the interstitial lining of their bladder
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our cat's urinary problems. Apparantly it is good for the interstitial lining of their bladder, as well. Much less expensive than the veterinarian's option and the cat loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney B. Steadman

customer_reviews.title: I like to pinch it between my fingernails and let him ...
customer_reviews.text: Glycoflex had, over the span of several months, a significant effect on my old cat's ability to scoot around and jump on stuff. Plus he just goes bonkers for it since it's the only treat he gets. I like to pinch it between my fingernails and let him bite at it so that it takes him longer than half a second to enjoy it
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: The cats come running for them.
customer_reviews.text: My cats like them and I think they help with their arthritis. I can't give them 5 stars because I haven't eaten them myself and don't know how they taste. If they were crunchier they might help clean teeth.
customer_reviews.author: W. R. ThorneTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: My cat won't take them
customer_reviews.text: This could be a good product or a bad one, I haven't been able to use them properly. My cat is nearly 8 years old and has been having trouble jumping up onto high places like she used to. So I decided to try giving her joint supplements to see if they would help her. After unsuccessfully trying to sneak her a liquid supplement (and even trying to force it on her with a plastic syringe) I thought I would try these treats. But she won't eat them. I bought them specifically because other people on here said their pets loved them but I guess mine is just difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Lambert

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves them.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my cat who in her state of aging has gotten a little stiff lately. She also tore an ACL, so she has a few issues, but she loves these things. I have 3 cats total, so I give her a certain look or call her a certain way into the pantry so I can sneak it to her and she comes running. I think I have noticed a difference in how she is doing, but I am unable to give her the 2 a day consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Davis

customer_reviews.title: Not palatable for some cats
customer_reviews.text: Of my 4 cats, (including 2 that are feral and will eat just about anything) not one cat would eat these unless they were broken up and mixed with wet food. It may be a good product but I can not prove it by my cats.
customer_reviews.author: KJWongmo

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for arthritic cats
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for more than a year, and it has really helped my elderly cat. He has arthritis in his hip and back legs, which makes it very difficult for him to jump up on a chair or bed. But when he has these regularly, he can jump again. I ran out of them for about a month, and I could very quickly see his difficulties returning. After a couple of weeks back on the Glycoflex, he was back to jumping again.
customer_reviews.author: cats&ferrets

customer_reviews.title: Works amazingly, but taste is maybe off!
customer_reviews.text: I noticed my cat is much more active when he eats them, but the problem is getting him TO eat them. He doesn't like the taste, and it's a rather big treat. I break it into 3rds, or 4ths, and then hide the pieces in a pile of treats. He still can sniff them out sometimes
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 cats of which 2 (12 & 14) had been experiencing joint problems. My Vet from Banfield recommended this product so I decided to try it. Petsmart and Petco don't carry this product. My two cats look forward to their two treats each, every evening and I have to say it's made a world of difference. Now they can jump on the bed and even on their condo. The only problem is they're acting like teenagers and are very hyper.
customer_reviews.author: oath101

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is mature/senior, being at least 11 years or older. She absolutely LOVES these and comes running soon as I call out that it's vitamin time. I take my own vitamins then too. If I don't hand-feed it to her and put it in her food dish, she will eat these pieces before touching one bit of her food. I waited until I knew if this was a flash-in-the-pan about her liking it before I ordered more. Have ordered several packages since to have them on hand and not run out.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Mulcare

customer_reviews.title: May work ok, but only if your cat likes the flavor
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for us. Our cat ate two of these and refuses to touch the rest. The primary flavoring is green lipped mussels. Apparently not all cats like that flavor.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lockwood

customer_reviews.title: Happy Playful Kitty Again.
customer_reviews.text: Thought my 10-year old kitty was just slowing down but noticed he was recoiling if he was touched around the hips. Vet gave me these and he's running around like a maniac again!!!
customer_reviews.author: NIc Phillips

customer_reviews.title: The cat said "Gross! I'm not eating that. You eat it"
customer_reviews.text: My cats won't touch these nuggets. They do smell pretty nasty, but I figured my feeling about how they smell is not the same as a cat's, right? Well - 3 cats. They all say "Yuck - you eat We won't." So, we won't know if it helps them since they won't eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Willis

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Down by my feline friend
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my kitty didn't care for the taste. But you know cats what one may love another may walk away from. Really was hoping could to use this product as a treat.
customer_reviews.author: WebShopperLady

customer_reviews.title: The smell is sort of bad, and my cats will only eat them when ...
customer_reviews.text: The smell is sort of bad, and my cats will only eat them when they're really hungry. There doesn't seem to be a lot of alternatives for natural hip & joint supplements for cats. Pet Naturals makes one and the recent reviews suggest that their new formulation is not popular with cats either.
customer_reviews.author: tyester

customer_reviews.title: Lucas Loves Them!
customer_reviews.text: My cat was prescribed these along with special food after he had P.U. surgery and still showed blood in his urine. I thought it would be a problem getting him to eat them twice a day, since it's "medicine," but he comes running, and has even learned to "sit" before he will get one. And he's a CAT!! The easiest medicine ever to administer to a cat, and it seems to be helping him, which is the idea!!
customer_reviews.author: Kaatje

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.  It worked for my cat
customer_reviews.text: It is great. My cat likes it, so no struggles with pills. She is 14+ years old, very sedentary and started to limp. She no longer limps and is running after a little laser light I move around for her entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieA

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: My cats won't touch it, and even my dog won't eat it. It's useless if you can't make them eat it.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Some eat it, some don't.
customer_reviews.text: These smell pretty bad and I have two older cats, one eats them and one only sporadically. They seem to improve the "regular' users mobility.
customer_reviews.author: ralph1

customer_reviews.title: who is starting to show signs of age like stiffness, difficulty jumping etc
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 13 year old cat Charlie, who is starting to show signs of age like stiffness, difficulty jumping etc. First of all, he LOVES the taste of these. They smell gross, but he absolutely loves them, which is weird because he is a treat snob. I noticed a difference in a couple of days. Moving quicker and more loose, jumping with less hesitation. He even started playing with a piece of paper! He hasn't done that in a while. He is just acting so much younger. I will definitely keep him on this!
customer_reviews.author: Kari Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Cats love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My cats eat these like they’re treats. I continue to buy them because my cats are better off with these daily vitamins
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 21 year old cat.(yes, 21 years old!). I was worried that she wouldn't eat them as she is very picky and at her advanced age a lot of foods and treats make her vomit. Not only does she love these "treats", she is able to move around much better. When I get home at the end of the day, she jumps easily off the couch to greet me (which she hadn't done for over a year), and follows me around until I give her the Glyco-Flex "treat". It took about a month to work, but it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonzabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The product was suggested by my vet for one of my cats. She’s responded beautifully and shows no limping. Easy to give to my pet as a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Henry

customer_reviews.title: 3 out of 3 cats won't eat these
customer_reviews.text: Three out of three cats won't eat these. Even wrapped in turkey. Even mixed with cod liver oil. It's possible all 3 of my cats are picky jerks. Or possibly the manufacturer just needs to work on some flavor science. The chews are also a little large and hard (even from a freshly opened non-expired bag) compared to some other brands, but they're higher in the joint stuff cats would need...if they would just eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name 1234

product_meta.title: VetriScience Laboratories Glyco-Flex II Bite-Sized Cat Chews
product_meta.description:
Size:60-countGlycoFlex 2 Hip and Joint Supplement for Cats represents stage 2 of our comprehensive joint support program designed to meet the needs of cats starting to slow down due to age, weight issues or the onset of joint health issues. Recommended by veterinarians for over 30 years, GlycoFlex 2 for cats includes quality joint support ingredients like glucosamine and MSM as well as our signature ingredient perna canaliculus sourced from the waters of New Zealand. Combined these ingredients lubricate and support joint structure and activity to help keep cats healthy and happy.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


GLYCO-FLEX® II FELINE 
Vetri-Science® Laboratories’ Glyco-Flex® II Feline combines the multiple benefits of GlycOmega® brand Perna and our DMG with glucosamine, methylsulfonylmethane (MSM), and manganese. This comprehensive blend of ingredients helps to optimize support of the structure and function of synovial joints in cats with increased need for joint support. 

GlycOmega® contains all major classes of GAGs that occur in connective tissue (joint cartilage, tendons, ligaments, and synovial fluids) like chondroitin sulfates and hyaluronic acid. 

RESEARCH AND UNDERSTANDING:
Over 17 years, researchers have conducted several studies to determine the abilities of Glyco-Flex’s® main ingredients and the product as a whole. The GlycOmega® (Perna used in Glyco-Flex) is exclusive to Vetri-Science.®

Out of top selling brands, Glyco-Flex® is the only joint support product line registered with the FDA as an animal health product. The GlycOmega® Perna whole mussel (used exclusively in Vetri-Science GlycoFlex® products) is the only New Zealand green lipped mussel clinically researched for its impact on the body’s inflammatory response.

PATENTED N,N-DIMETHYLGLYCINE HCL
Glyco-Flex® II Feline features our patented DMG, an adaptogen known for its immune support properties. DMG is naturally occurring in small amounts, and assists in methylation processes within the body. This amino acid derivative supports circulation and oxygen utilization, promoting better nutrient delivery to the joint. Vetri-Science® Laboratories has obtained four patents on DMG backed by 20 years of research. 

Image of a healthy Joint ADDED MSM
Because Glyco-Flex® II Feline is designed to represent serious support; we’ve added MSM to our tablet and chewable formulas. MSM, or Methylsulfonylmethane, is an organic, sulfur-containing compound. Glycosaminoglycans (GAGs), the fundamental building blocks of joint cartilage, are linked together by disulfide bonds (bonds between two sulfur atoms). Because cartilage is in a sulfur-dependent state of quality, MSM supports joint and connective tissue health. 

ADDED GLUCOSAMINE
Glyco-Flex® II stands out because of added glucosamine. A natural compound found in healthy cartilage, glucosamine sulfate is a constituent of glycosaminoglycans in synovial fluid, meaning it supports joint health through promoting synovial fluid viscosity and strength of the cartilage matrix. 

EVEN THE TASTE IS OPTIMAL
Available in both a tablet formula and a chicken liver-flavored bite size chew, Glyco-Flex® II Feline is known for its high palatability.
feature_bullets: The GlycoFlex Joint Support Stages system has been trusted and recommended by veterinarians for over 30 years. All VetriScience products are veterinarian formulated and approved by our veterinary review board.
Our soft chews are naturally flavored with real chicken liver and formulated specifically for cats.
GlycoFlex 2 includes clinically proven ingredients to build cartilage, support the synovial fluid in the joints and manage irritating inflammation.
For cats showing signs of joint discomfort and loss of mobility.
VetriScience products are manufactured in the U.S.A
